p: Still, such issues may one day make the priority list of more island countries—the authors point out that their assessment is only the first step in a long journey, and they expect the countries’ adaptation plans to go through frequent revisions in the future. McIver says, “Each country would likely benefit from further support both in doing more sophisticated analysis of climate-sensitive health risks and climate variability and change, and in considering ways those adaption plans can be incorporated into the health and other sector policies.”
